p: The results indicated a correlation between considering possible treatments for psychological disorders and gender, age, region of origin, educational level, occupation, social status, living conditions, and monthly income of the participants. However, the gender of the participant correlated significantly with considering spiritual activity as a possible treatment for psychological disorders, where 27.8% of the female participants believed in spiritual exercises compared to 17.7% of the male participants. While meditation could represent one of the spiritual exercises, the study shows that meditation might be more beneficial to females than to males due to differences in the mechanism of emotion regulation ( 19). This factor might explain why female participants showed a stronger belief in spiritual exercises than males in our study.
